sen.j: 鞍馬口駅（くらまぐちえき）は、京都府京都市上京区上御霊中町にある、京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄烏丸線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Kuramaguchi Station, located in Kamigoryo Nakamachi, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a railway station of the Karasuma Line of Kyoto Municipal Subway.
Kuramaguchi Station, located in Kamigoryo Nakamachi, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a railway facility of the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway.
Kuramaguchi Station, located in Kamigoryo Nakamachi, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility of the Karasuma Line of the Kyoto Municipal Subway.

sen.j: 島式1面2線のプラットホームを持つ地下駅である。

This station is an underground facility having an island-type platform for two tracks.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。

sen.j: しばしば鞍馬寺へのアクセス拠点と勘違いされるが、当駅から鞍馬までは直線距離で北へ10km近く離れており、連絡するバス路線もない。
sen.e: Although it is often misunderstood as the nearest station to Kurama-dera Temple, Kurama is nearly 10 km away in a straight line to the northward from this station and no bus line connecting to Kurama is available.

Although it's often incorrectly considered to be the station nearest to Kurama-dera Temple, Kurama is nearly 10 km northward from this station (as the crow flies) and no bus line connecting to Kurama is available.

Although it's often incorrectly considered to be the station nearest to Kurama-dera Temple, Kurama is nearly 10 km northward from this station (as the crow flies) and no bus line connecting to Kurama is available.

sen.j: この駅名は烏丸通と鞍馬口通の交差点である烏丸鞍馬口に由来し、京の七口の一つである鞍馬口は当駅の東約500mの出雲路橋西詰（北区鞍馬口町）にある。
sen.e: The name of this station derives from Karasuma-Kuramaguchi, which is the crossing of Karasuma-dori Street and Kuramaguchi-dori Street, and Kuramaguchi, which is one of "Kyo-no-Nanakuchi" (seven entrances of Kyoto), is located at the west end of Izumoji-bashi Bridge (Kuramaguchi-cho, Kita Ward), about 500m away to the eastward from this station.

The station's name derives from Karasuma-Kuramaguchi, which is the crossing of Karasuma-dori Street and Kuramaguchi-dori Street, and Kuramaguchi, which is one of the "Kyo-no-Nanakuchi" (seven entrances of Kyoto), is located at the west end of Izumoji-bashi Bridge (Kuramaguchi-cho, Kita Ward), about 500m east of the station.

The station's name derives from Karasuma-Kuramaguchi, which is the crossing of Karasuma-dori Street and Kuramaguchi-dori Street, and Kuramaguchi, which is one of the "Kyo-no-Nanakuchi" (seven entrances of Kyoto), is located at the west end of Izumoji-bashi Bridge (Kuramaguchi-cho, Kita Ward), about 500m east of the station.

sen.j: また、鞍馬方面へのアクセスだが、国際会館駅から叡山電鉄鞍馬線岩倉駅_(京都府)と八幡前駅_(京都府)へは徒歩で移動できる距離である。
sen.e: In order to go to Kurama, it is convenient to transfer at Kokusaikaikan Station of the Karasuma Line since passengers can move on foot to Iwakura Station or Hachiman-mae Station of the Kurama Line operated by Eizan Electric Railway Co.,Ltd.

To reach Kurama, it's convenient to transfer at Kokusaikaikan Station of the Karasuma Line because passengers can go on foot to Iwakura Station or Hachiman-mae Station of the Kurama Line, which is operated by the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.

To reach Kurama, it's convenient to transfer at Kokusaikaikan Station of the Karasuma Line because passengers can go on foot to Iwakura Station (Kyoto Prefecture) or Hachiman-mae Station (Kyoto Prefecture) of the Kurama Line, which is operated by the Eizan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 京都府 を追加しました。

sen.j: そのため、烏丸線国際会館方面行きの車内では、当駅到着前に「貴船・鞍馬方面へは、国際会館駅までご乗車下さい」というアナウンスがある。
sen.e: Under such circustances, an announcement saying "passengers going to Kibune/Kurama, please get off at Kokusaikaikan Station" is made in trains bound for Kokusaikaikan before arriving at this station.

Under such circumstances, an announcement saying, "Passengers going to Kibune/Kurama, please get off at Kokusaikaikan Station," is made on the trains bound for Kokusaikaikan before their arrival at this station.

Under such circumstances, an announcement saying, 'Passengers going to Kibune/Kurama, please get off at Kokusaikaikan Station,' is made on the trains bound for Kokusaikaikan of the Karasuma Line before their arrival at this station.
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。烏丸線 を追加しました。

sen.j: 1981年（昭和56年）5月29日 烏丸線の開通とともに開業。

May 29, 1981: This station commenced operation in association with the opening of the Karasuma Line.
